title: 108_hr1367
content: The Act is titled the "National Veterinary Medical Service Act" and establishes a loan repayment program for veterinary medicine. The National Veterinary Medical Service Act establishes a program for veterinarians to provide services in shortage situations and emergency situations for the federal government. The program includes agreements with veterinarians to provide veterinary services in shortage situations and repay qualifying educational loans. The National Veterinary Medical Service Act allows veterinarians to provide services to the Federal Government in emergency situations under agreements that include repayment of educational loans. Veterinarians are not required to work more than 60 days per year and will receive a salary and travel reimbursement. The National Veterinary Medical Service Act allows veterinarians to provide services to the Federal Government in shortage situations. The Secretary determines shortage areas based on urban or rural locations, specific veterinary practices, federal government needs, and other relevant factors. The program can be administered directly by the Secretary or through agreements with other agencies or service providers. The program provides breach remedies for participants, including repayment of financial assistance with interest. Funds recovered are credited back to the program account. The Secretary may waive repayment in cases of extreme hardship. Regulations determine the amount of loan repayment for a year of service by a veterinarian. The Veterinary Medicine Loan Repayment Program considers the impact on maximizing agreements and incentivizing service in shortage areas. Loan repayments cover tuition and other educational expenses for veterinary medicine degrees. The Veterinary Medicine Loan Repayment Program covers tuition, fees, books, and living expenses for participants. The Secretary can establish repayment schedules with loan holders and provide additional payments for tax liabilities. Authorization of appropriations is provided for program implementation. The Secretary is authorized to appropriate necessary sums for the Veterinary Medicine Loan Repayment Program, which will remain available until expended.
